analyzed: kaṇikāra vagga  pāda phaliya tthera a padāna
translated: The Chapter with Kaṇikāra Trees🔽The Story of the Elder Pādaphali🔽I offered a fruit
to the One with a Golden complexion,
the One who is Worthy, the One who receives offerings,
as he was walking along the road.

analyzed: ekanavutitaḥ kappe  yam phalam adadim tadā

translated: I did not go to a bad rebirth,
this is the result of offering the fruit.
My defilements have been burned up,
I have done what the Awakened One said.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pādaphaliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā pādaphaliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Pādaphali recited these verses.
The story of the elder Pādaphali is the fifth.
